about_the_game:
In a world where the Earth is collapsing due to violent volcanic eruptions, survival has become a daily battle. The air is thick with ash, water is scarce and food is virtually non-existent. In this desolate scenario, you take on the role of Rex, a young and fearless Tyrannosaurus with a voracious appetite.

A Journey for Survival

Rex faces a relentless fight against hunger, and the only way out is to feed on the precious pterodactyl eggs. Each bite brings a momentary break, but the hunger persists, creating an endless cycle of survival.

Game Features (Demo):

  • Casual and 2D Platformer.

  • Adventure and Survival Mode.

  • Explore stunning environments, full of color and traps in an adventure mode.

  • Face epic challenges as you collect eggs and try to escape the clutches of ferocious pterodactyls.

  • Use your wits and strategy to overcome obstacles and get through challenging stages.

  • Collect as many eggs as you can to complete each level.

  • Feel the tension growing as Rex's hunger and the pterodactyl threat intensify with each passing moment in a survival mode.

  • Survive as long as possible in a survival mode.

Prepare for the battle of your life and fight for survival in "Pterodactyl Attack"! Do you have what it takes to face the fury of the heavens and survive the prehistoric apocalypse?

name: Pterodactyl Attack Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 - 1.8 GHZ
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 620
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 - 1.8 GHZ
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 620
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

short_description: A Journey for Survival. Rex faces a relentless fight against hunger in a casual 2D platformer. A mix of adventure and survival modes with a focus on overcoming obstacles and escaping the clutches of angry pterodactyls.
